args.natural_language_statement: Prove that a metric space X is compact iff X is sequentially compact. Translate to Lean4 syntax (statement only, no proof). End with ' := by sorry'.

retrieved_examples.nl: Every continuous image of a compact space is compact.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem continuous_on.compact_image {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] {f : X ‚Üí Y} (hf : Continuous f) (h : CompactSpace X) : CompactSpace (Set.range f) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: A set in a metric space is compact iff it is complete and totally bounded.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- A metric space X is compact iff X is sequentially compact. -/
theorem metric_space.compact_iff_sequentially_compact {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] :
  CompactSpace X ‚Üî
  ‚àÄ (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (x : X) (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono œÜ ‚àß Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) atTop (ùìù x) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- A metric space X is compact iff X is sequentially compact. -/

  CompactSpace X ‚Üî
  ‚àÄ (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (x : X) (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono œÜ ‚àß Filter.Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) Filter.atTop (ùìù x) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- A metric space X is compact iff X is sequentially compact. -/
theorem metric_space.compact_iff_sequentially_compact {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] :
  CompactSpace X ‚Üî
  ‚àÄ (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (x : X) (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono œÜ ‚àß Filter.Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) Filter.atTop (Filter.nhds x) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- A metric space X is compact iff X is sequentially compact. -/
theorem metric_space.compact_iff_sequentially_compact {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] :
  CompactSpace X ‚Üî
  ‚àÄ (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (x : X) (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono œÜ ‚àß Filter.Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) Filter.atTop (nhds x) := by sorry
